captions.text: You need to have a pee.

If you don't pee, you can't
watch TV, can you?

> Why do you have
lots of hair growing?

> Women don't have hair,
not as much.

> Daddy will do it
alone then, Tai-Chan.

When daddy has put
the incense in,

When daddy has put
the incense in here.
> Good, now put the incense out.

> Guys, it's not good
to fall in love with girls

You have wives,
so you are all right.
Whereas I don't have a wife.

> What day is it today?
> The 24th.

> Then what day
do you think it is?

> Kompiang,
was I a naughty child?

> How long have you been
working for our family?

to indicate that
the ceremony has ended.

The water is an offering
for Him.
> I had a major heart operation.

> Oh, my God,
did you feel that?

Have a listen
if he's sleeping.

woman: All right, then.
Oh! Come over here!
What a little miracle you are!

Now your mama has made herself
a little copy of Mama.

It doesn't matter
South or North Korea.

I'm traveling
around the world by bicycle.

> Today it's been
9 years and 36 days.

I have been in
190 countries so far.

I've been struck by cars
six times.

There are so many careless
drivers in the world.

I have seen many
different sizes of fly.

In North Africa,
smaller fly than here.

And Turkey,
smaller fly than here.

But this size
is same fly in Korea

which I need every day
in order to live.

> Oh, and I have
this plastic glove

from when I was at work
the other day.

> It's a small branch
from the Neem tree.
> What do you use it for?

> I have nothing
in my pockets. Zero.
To make a lot of money.

man: The cold weather is here
and August will be worse,

so you have to
keep warm, Abel.
> Hey you, this is my patch.

When I was little, I once
earned 20 soles in a day.
> My story is, I can't work,

because who else would look
after my kids?

My wife passed away,
my children's mother.

I've got a 20 year old son
who is sick.

We have to tie him up all day
to stop him wandering off.

Fourteen people
live in this place.

We have no electricity,
no water, no drains.

God wouldn't have created this
population just to forget us.

I've been in Dubai
for 13 years.

man speaking native language:
There is no work at home.

It's more profitable
to come to Dubai.

I'm here to earn money
to send back to my kids.

man speaking native language:
Pray, be seated.

> All you think about
is your belly.

> Did you see the fence
fell down in those thistles?
And you think I'm a prick.

> This is how
brynza cheese is made.

When all liquid is removed,
the cheese becomes very good.

Nearly as good
as the Dutch cheese.

It even has holes,
in just two, three days.

> Well, it goes in
and out again, like a needle.
Nothing comes out of the gun.
> Who do you love a lot?

He prepares everything,
all the food we eat.

He cares more about me
than his work.

The thing I love the most
is my laptop.

In Wikipedia, there are
stories, history, math,
> Placing my feet in wet sand.

to the person I love
most in the world.

cleaning something that's really
dirty so you can see the result.
> This one doesn't lift me up.
> There is a new one over here.
You have to pull on this one.

> You have to pull
using your dorsal muscles.

and you position yourself
with parallel feet

so you can use
your dorsal muscles.

woman: Are you trying
every possible way?
I told you it won't move.

So, what was it
you were saying?

> Yeah. You did get
all dressed up, didn't you?

Can I do something
to reunite Korea?

It looks impossible.
It looks out of my hands.

Okay.
You do a great zombie.
> When I come to work at 1:00 A.M.

and I hear little noises
here and there.

> I'm afraid for all the
people that don't know God.

People who don't get saved
are going to hell.

in the morning, I'm not sure
if I'll return home safely.

No Afghans expect to
return home safely.

and I don't have
a boy or girl

and no one will ever
call me "mummy."

> Because what if God
isn't real?

I believe in Him,
but what if God isn't real?

And we're just going to lie
in the ground, dead forever?

> The dogs are
frightened of thunder.

> Vasya, we need to find
some fireworks somewhere.

Because in autumn,
wolves will come.

> We need to hurry home.
It's going to rain!

Look at the side.
What are they doing there?

> I don't want to
move out of the way.

> A tunnel
has become a death trap.

At least 18 people were kicked
or crushed to death

in a stampede during
The Love Parade in Duisburg.

> Many of the hundreds
of thousands of revelers

were unaware
of the tragedy unfolding.

I can see all different people
in the world

from town to town,
from country to country.

I can feel it, I can touch it,
I can see it.

I feel like born again
because of my haircut.

It's time to continue
my journey.

comments.author: Алеся Дмитракова

comments.text:
Um dia dois caras conhecidos no mundo dos filmes, Ridley e Tom Scott (com o 
apoio da LG) resolveram montar uma ideia. Convocaram pessoas do mundo todo 
para enviar vídeos que pudessem compor o projeto A Life In A Day... 
Resultado:  80.000 vídeos de 192 nações foram editados para compor o que 
apresento abaixo...

Life in a Day is a crowdsourced drama/documentary film comprising an 
arranged series of video clips selected from 80,000 clips submitted to the 
YouTube video sharing website, the clips showing respective occurrences 
from around the world on a single day, July 24, 2010.
The film is 94 minutes 53 seconds long and includes scenes selected from 
4,500 hours of footage in 80,000 submissions from 192 nations. The 
completed film debuted at the Sundance Film Festival on January 27, 2011.

#movie #film #life #filme #vida #ridleyscott #youtube  ﻿

comments.author: Tanay Choudhury

comments.text:
La Vida en un Día (o la Tierra en 35 mm)

“¿A qué le temes?”...
“¿Qué es lo que más amas?”...
“¿Qué te hace reír?”...
“¿Qué llevas en el bolsillo?”...
Cuatro preguntas. Cuatro preguntas y una fecha: sábado 24 de Julio de 2010… 
Ese día y gracias a aquellas sencillas interrogantes nuestro planeta se 
convirtió en un poema. En una oda a la vida, a la Tierra, y a sus miles de 
millones de diferentes formas de vida que le dan vida. A sus claros y sus 
oscuros, a su imponencia pero también a sus detalles más sutiles y mínimos.
Life in a day, o La Vida en un Día como se la llamó en español, es una 
película documental –y experimental- producida por la plataforma de videos 
YouTube y Ridley Scott y dirigida por el realizador británico Kevin 
Macdonald, con el apoyo de la compañía surcoreana LG.
Sin embargo, no es una cinta cualquiera. Fue hecha con la contribución de 
más de 82 mil personas de 192 países que aceptaron el reto de la red 
social: documentar en video fragmentos de su vida durante las 24 horas que 
comprendieron el sábado 24 de Julio de 2010. El material fue posteriormente 
subido en un canal especialmente creado para este fin por el popular portal.
El resultado final fue más 4.500 horas de grabación. De ellas se seleccionó 
diez horas con el mejor material, de donde finalmente salieron los 94 
minutos y 57 segundos que conforman la película estrenada en 2011, en el 
prestigioso festival de cine independiente de Sundance. Y si bien 
constituye el primer trabajo audiovisual realizado en el mundo bajo esta 
modalidad, se distingue por sobre todo por ser un homenaje a la Tierra. Y a 
la vida.
La cinta permite lo imposible: asomarse a más 82 mil puntos de vistas 
diferentes y a las distintas perspectivas de gente que vive alrededor del 
mundo. Atestiguar instantes únicos como la primera afeitada de un 
adolescente, el comienzo de la jornada diaria de un pastor de ovejas en 
Ucrania, el magnético canto de tres mujeres en Angola mientras machacan el 
maíz que se convertirá en su alimento, o como un joven estadounidense le 
revela a su abuela su homosexualidad.
También ser privilegiados testigos de momentos intensamente emocionales 
como el que muestra a una pareja de avanzada edad demostrándose su amor y 
enumerando sus actos sucios mientras celebra sus votos matrimoniales, la 
difícil situación de una familia lidiando con la mastectomía de la esposa, 
la estimulante caída libre de un paracaidista, el dolor de un hombre en su 
lecho de muerte, y hasta la perturbadora forma en que matan a una vaca en 
un camal.
La vida en un día es mucho más que una película, o que un honesto homenaje 
a la vida y el planeta. Es un legado para las futuras generaciones. Es una 
verdadera cápsula del actual tiempo de la Tierra, del amor y la alegría, 
pero también de sus tragedias. Es un maravilloso homenaje a la Pachamama, 
perfecto para ser visto en este Día Internacional de la Madre Tierra.
Si esta cinta se volviera a hacer después de uno o dos siglos, ¿cómo sería 
la Tierra?... ¿Cómo sería un día en la vida de ese planeta?... ¿Cuáles 
serían las respuestas?...
“¿A qué le temes?”...
“¿Qué es lo que más amas?”...
“¿Qué te hace reír?”...
“¿Qué llevas en el bolsillo?”...
 
Por Emilio José Carrión﻿

comments.author: S'port klimovsk (finik play)

comments.text:
Very Creative! Great idea! Congrads! But one of the worst things i've seen 
thats designed to depress you, make you wonder, and give you a ton of 
stress, and make your life shorter than it is! I bet anyone who watches 
this will go to sleep thinking negative. Honestly, the news, TV, and all 
other brainwashing does enough. the world is already in poverty, why make 
it worse? Like seriously. The very least thing you could do is include a 
scene of hope or even less, use the same movie in an order from sad to 
happy, not the other way around. All you need to know is everything happens 
for a reason, and any person wether its in a movie or real life is the 
reason they're in the place they are. Take example of a guy with a bike who 
traveled over 190 countries. Those people that are sad and hope that shit 
will be magically arranged to them by god, could take the same path as the 
guy on the bike based on their own decision, and eventually they'll stumble 
upon something. Simple as that. So no disrespect to creators of this movie, 
and yes i got to say its an eye opener like holy fuck wow, your here and 
then there and then boom this happens and that (hold on brushing my teeth) 
but if you wanted to show the world a documentary do something for better 
not for worse. Because i bet you i could find a person in any given country 
in the world who wears a suit and a tie, lives in a nice home has a loving 
rich of happiness family, and that person came from the same little kid 
that cleaned shoes, or slept in a boat, or even in the dumpsters surrounded 
by drug addicts. This is the same thing as movie The Secret, but does 
completely opposite. I hope i gave enough resons why i didnt like this 
movie. And really its not that i dont care, but things like this brainwash 
you without you realizing, and give it enough time you'll end up in the 
same boat.﻿

comments.text:
Sonder -  the realization that each random passerby is living a life as 
vivid and complex as your own—populated with their own ambitions, friends, 
routines, worries and inherited craziness—an epic story that continues 
invisibly around you like an anthill sprawling deep underground, with 
elaborate passageways to thousands of other lives that you’ll never know 
existed, in which you might appear only once, as an extra sipping coffee in 
the background, as a blur of traffic passing on the highway, as a lighted 
window at dusk.﻿

comments.author: Wenceslao Jara

comments.text:
i cannot believe that i fully watched this film. it is interesting that 
there is a countless number of people existing in this world and each one 
of them has a different day. i am no one. i am not interesting enough and i 
do not think i'll be a world known famous person someday BUT i simply want 
to be known by a lot of ppl that i exist. (: anyway, anyone who reads this, 
have a beautiful wonderful and magical day! *big hugs*

 twitter @FukuokaMiki ﻿

comments.author: Caroline Roellinghoff

comments.text:
All I can say is that all people of all the world are happy, "poor" people 
and "rich" people, both kinds are really happy of their life including me, 
and I'm so proud of it, I'm so proud of all the humanity, cause nothing is 
impossible to be happy, I love this movie because is so amazing to see how 
all people of the world can be so happy, even though in many countries are 
many problems, I know that also exist many persons being happy, just like 
me, happy for stay alive and with the pleasure for enjoy the life﻿
comments.author: Rodrigo Arciniega

comments.text:
TITLE: Life In A Day (2011/1080p/crowdsourced documentary)

Life in a Day is a crowdsourced drama/documentary film comprising an 
arranged series of video clips selected from 80,000 clips submitted to the 
YouTube video SHARING website, the clips showing respective occurrences 
from around the world on a single day, July 24, 2010.﻿
